contextualization.firstLine: Upload any MIDI file to interpret it as you please!
contextualization.secondLine: You can use an external MIDI controller, or your computer keyboard.
contextualization.thirdLine: Try altering legato, tempo or velocity.

noScores.message: Looking for scores? You can find some

guide.how: How to use the Midifile Performer ?

io.heading: Manage MIDI inputs and audio outputs
io.default: By default, your computer keyboard can be used; the four alphanumerical rows each have ten active keys sharing the same velocity: from pianissimo for the lowermost row (beginning with Z on a QWERTY keyboard) to fortissimo for the uppermost row (the number row). If your device has a trackpad, it will be active as well. These velocities may be adjusted to your convenience.
io.custom: You may also plug in any USB MIDI controller to pilot the application. A built-in piano synth is the default audio output, but any VSTs of your own (e.g. : Pianoteq) may also be selected.

score.heading: Uploading and managing files
score.instructions: You can import any MIDI file to interpret it in your own way. To do so, click on the "Upload a MIDI file" button, or drag and drop the file directly on the page.

advice.heading: Advice on file sorting
advice.content: You may create a folder for each piece or each composer, which can hold the PDF score, the MIDI file, and your recorded interpretations.

sequence.heading: Managing the selected sequence:
sequence.default: By default, the sequence in play begins with the piece's first note, and ends with the last note
sequence.select: You may select a specific section to play by using the index of the desired notes, or the flags on the scroll bar
sequence.cursor: Moving the progress bar's cursor will move to this point in the piece
sequence.rewind: Press the "Rewind" button to jump to the start of the selected sequence; you will also loop to the start when reaching its end

export.heading: Export an interpretation
export.content: The "Export" button will download a MIDI file containing your last interpretation of the piece or sequence. You can then make use of it through the software of your choice.

loading.beforeClick: Please click anywhere to load the synth.
